Message:
The girl who came
to leave flowers for Aura
was the very one who had
once wished for her ailing
grandmother to be cured.

“My grandmother died,
but I haven’t been able
to cry at all...
I’m a horrible grandchild,
aren’t I...”

It was just like my face...
reflected in the casket’s icy glass...

“But, you look like you’re
on the verge of tears
as we speak.”

Once my words had sunk in,
the floodgates opened,
and the girl broke
into heaving sobs.

When she had wept
every last tear, the girl—
Tillie—set her bundle
of wildflowers atop
Aura’s casket.

The sight gave me
a sense of peace,
and for the first time in ages,
I let down my guard...

So much so, I didn’t notice
the group of humans
closing in on Tillie from behind...
